summary: Dracaena trifasciata, often called the snake plant, is a popular houseplant from West Africa. It's easy to care for and can survive with little water and sunlight. You might also know it by other names like Saint George's sword or mother-in-law's tongue. Previously, it was called Sansevieria trifasciata before a change in 2017. Its official family is Asparagaceae.
title: Dracaena trifasciata
